Label: SC_PREMIUM_RATE
Comment:
"As per DOT's doc 116 is for ""Wakeup call Registration"" and 117 for ""Wakeup call
Cancellation"". Dialling format 11[67] + <hours_in_24_hours_format> + <minutes>. This
service costs double the standard rate.
http://delhi.mtnl.net.in/services/phonewakeup.htm"

Label: SC_PREMIUM_RATE
Comment: "Added Vodafone number 56161561 based on their website."

Label: SC_SHORT_CODE
Comment:
"1802 - Virtual Card calling (VCC) codes are actually access codes for making VCC calls as
per http://www.cdothelpline.ernet.in/documents/C-DOT_IN/INS&FDES.PDF. Not adding them to
phone or short number metadata as there are no valid numbers online. Same is the case
with 1804 Account Card Calling (ACC) numbers."

Label: SC_SHORT_CODE
Comment: "As per telenor.in doc supporting only specific ones with length less than 5 digits.\nSimplified the ranges when short code is more than 5 digits. Not adding these short codes\nto respective categories because of maintainability."

Label: SC_SHORT_CODE
Comment: "5902XXXX short codes were supported based on user report."

Label: SC_STANDARD_RATE
Comment: "Cost of SMS to 5142[5-9], 514[34]\\d and 5757555 is of standard rate."

Label: XML_FIXED_LINE
Comment:
"This pattern has 3 parts: 2-digit NDCs, 3-digit NDCs, and 4-digit NDCs. This is because
the subscriber number following NDCs always begins with the operator codes 2-7. Not all
operator codes are available in all NDCs, but we don't maintain that level of
granularity. 4-digit NDCs are only maintained up to 3-digit granularity, unless more is
needed to disambiguate from e.g. mobile ranges."

Label: XML_MOBILE
Comment: "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_telephone_numbering_in_India"

Label: XML_MOBILE
Comment: "The document titled ""List of MSC codes"" linked off\nhttp://www.dot.gov.in/access-services/national-numbering-plan-2003 was helpful but last\nupdated 2012 - more updates at http://www.dot.gov.in/access-services/allotment-msc-codes."

Label: XML_MOBILE
Comment:
"A couple of additional prefixes found neither on the wikipedia page nor in the MSC
codes list, are added because SMS messages have been successfully sent to these
numbers. It seems almost impossible to know for some of these numbers whether they are
land-line or mobile, since the ranges overlap. We go to a maximum depth of five where
necessary to distinguish between mobile and fixed-line numbers. Extra prefixes added:
6391, 7317[2-4], 7601, 768[56][1-7], 7695, 81145, 83178, 83287 and 83678. New prefixes
were also added based on the document provided from mobile carriers:
https://github.com/google/libphonenumber/issues/260 and
https://github.com/google/libphonenumber/pull/692/"

Label: XML_PREMIUM_RATE
Comment:
"Only televoting numbers are covered here for now. The 900 numbers are not covered
because they overlap with mobile, and we haven't found any real numbers online.
1863 424 Tele-voting (Different Charge Rate) numbers are not added as there are no
valid numbers online."

Label: XML_SHARED_COST
Comment: "While described as ""universal numbers"" in the numbering plan, evidence suggests\nthat 1860 number are best described as shared cost. See ""Call Local Service"" in:\nhttp://www.tatadocomo.com/corporates/toll-free.aspx"

Label: XML_TOLL_FREE
Comment:
"Information gathered from sites such as
http://www.surfindia.com/india-facts/toll-free-no.html and
http://indmusings.blogspot.com/2008/09/free-help-line-numbersindia.html
http://www.bsnl.co.in/service/telev.htm"

Label: XML_UAN
Comment: "Telemarketing numbers: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_India. 1869 -\nlong distance UAN numbers are not added here as there are no valid numbers online."
